page.title: 04Edlington Wood History
page.content: Edlington wood has an interesting {Historical background}.There is evidence of a{Roman settlement}dating back to at least the late 2nd or 3rd century A.D. At the time of the Domesday survey 1680 acres of{pasturable woodland {covered the}Edlington Manor. Yet in medieval times the area of woodland was as small as{80 acres.} In 1700 the Manor was purchased by {Robert Molesworth who replanted the {wood}as an estate, resulting in about 300 acres of woodland with ride-ways radiating from a central point.This point still being marked by a classical greyhound monument. However, during the late 1970's{tree felling {removed about 90 acres.}This has been replaced with arable farmland in the middle of the wood.{(Not shown on {recent O.S.Maps)
